answers.answer: I wouldn't worry too much. Do you know how far along you are? If you're early it could just be implantation cramping and with the morning sickness I find that you get a cramped up stomach at first

I am around 4 weeks so only early and the past 3 mornings I have been throwing up and feeling sick then after a little while I feel good as new and just really tired and the pains in the lower tummy don't stay for long they come and go but it's just little pains
Totally normal love! Im only 4 weeks aswell and the cramping (nothing too jusy just achey) and sickness has been lasting all day every day since just after ovulation.
Ok that is good then as I don't remember having cramps when I was first pregnant with my son thank you and congratulations :)

Ahhhh you are lucky you dont remember them haha i remember the 1st trimester like it was yesterday (it was almost 4 years ago that i found out i was pregnant!) The sickness and cramping were shocking! Congrats to you too! Do you know roughly when you are due?

I remember most of it my son is 2 in 3 months and I had a really good start to the pregnancy with him I never had morning sickness or cramping it was really smooth up untikl 25 weeks and I went into premature Labour and had to stay in hospital till I was 34 weeks and then I got high blood pressure and  preeclampsia so they had to induce me 2 weeks early as my blood pressure was going through the roof.And I have to wait for my blood test to come back which is today or tomorrow so I worked it out from my last period and if I go from that I am 5 weeks today which I would be due around 15 of March

question: Hi all I have just found out that I am pregnant with my second and I was just wondering is it normal to get a few pains in the lower tummy and to have morning sickness so early? I have never had morning sickness with my son and I don't know if it is morning sickness or not ?
title: Baby 2 on the way
